history.content:
Yes! You can P/NP CS61b and retake it for a letter grade next semester BUT you have to receive a NP. If you receive a P, then you may not retake it and have it count towards your major petition.

If you're struggling with CS61b, there are a lot of great resources that you can take advantage of such as the CSM group tutoring (I personally did this and found it to be extremely helpful), OH (start on projects early so you can ask TA questions before everyone starts flooding the TAs with question), Youtube (there are lots of great videos on sorting algorithms, graph traversals, etc), and try to find people that you can study with!

Good luck!

Additional information on retaking classes can be found on the website here. I've copied relevant info below.

  • Repeating courses to get higher grades is strongly discouraged. You may repeat a course only if you received a NP or grade below C-, and can only retake a particular prerequisite ONCE with the repeated grade being final. You can only retake a maximum of 12 units.

children.subject: I'd disagree with the Instructor answer. Under the current system, retaking courses after NP/Failing is highly encouraged, since 12 units is enough to retake all of the lower division requirements and the "penalty" for receiving a C- is not being able to declare, while failing means you have a second shot.

history.content: Is it possible to P/NP CS61B and retake it next semester for an LG and use that grade for your major petition?
history.subject: Retake CS61B
